newsitem.title: USA: Texaco -Eugene Island 176 kbpd line shut.
newsitem.headline: Texaco -Eugene Island 176 kbpd line shut.

text.p: Texaco Inc said Monday that its 176,000 barrels per day (bpd) Eugene Island pipeline was shut in since Friday evening after a split in the pipeline caused a spill into Lake Barre in Louisiana.

About 20,000 bpd of the crude oil has been diverted to the Poseidon pipeline system, also operated by Texaco, and the company was looking for alternative routes for more oil, said Pierre DeGruy, a Texaco Spokesman.
The pipeline break caused a spill of between 250 and 400 barrels of crude oil into the lake, which was being attended by Texaco, Coast Guard and other response teams.

The spill occured Friday evening in the water at Lake Barre, Terrebone, which is located about 27 miles from Houma, in south Louisiana near the Gulf of Mexico coast, said Texaco spokesman Paul Weeditz in Houston.
"Our Gulf Coast spill response team responded and the Coast Guard were mobilizing a number of ships -- about 17 skimming vessels, I believe -- over the weekend," said Weeditz.
There was no report of damage to local wildlife so far and part of the response operation was to boom off a number of grassy islands in the lake, he said.
